result.execSummary:
The defendant Wioletta Nowak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court allows transfer of probation to State of Illinois.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain and maintain FTE and/or school
No contact with victims; The Trek Store (Wausau), Michaels Craft Store (Wausau).

Any assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by PO. 

Complete Corrective /Criminal Thinking Class.  DNA Sample. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wioletta Nowak

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case Called: 11:35am. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Brett Reetz. Interpreter, Iwona Sirenc sworn & interprets. State to file Information by close of business today - Defense in agreement. *VRCW. COURT address conflict of counsel for Atty Reetz and Defendant/Co-Defendant Tomasz Gan. Atty Reetz makes statement. Defendant in agreement - waives conflict for counsel. COURT accepts Waiver of Conflict. Waiver of Prelim. filed.  Court questions deft as to waiver.  Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.  COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  Information to be filed by the end of close of business today. COURT proceeds with Plea. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to DRI ct 2 (retail theft/party to) - crt grants. PLEA: NO CONTEST- ct 1 (retail theft/party to). Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  Statements by State & Defense. Atty Reetz states Defendant's name also is EMILLA NOGAJ. Defendant makes statement. COURT ORDERS: SWH - 2 yrs probation. CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; Complete Corrective/Criminal Thinking class; No Contact  w/victims the Trek Store- Wausau; Michaels Craft Store- Wausau; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school; Court Costs; DNA Sample & Surcharge; DNA Surcharge effective January 2014. COURT allows for transfer of probation to State of IL. 19 days credit in any event of revocation. Crt informs and Defendant signs Voter Ineligibility Form. Adjourned: 12: 10pm.
Plea hearing on March 24, 2015 at 10:45 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

Court ordered $25,000.00 cash on 3-5-15.
Origianl warrant returned from Sheriff's Dept.

No contact with victim(s):  Trek (Wausau), Michaels (Rib Mt), co-defts; T.G. and Z.D.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
